body:
Hey @hejops 
the issue seems to be that some tensors are stored on the CPU and others on the GPU. This  causes the error. I tried to reproduce the issue with the master branch, but it worked out well for me. Are you using the current master branch or the pip version?
I'm using the pip version. I'll try the master branch and give you an update.

I tried to do training on master (5dd3d3f), but the following CUDA error is produced. Both my GPUs are indeed in use, but I thought that shouldn't matter since I didn't specify `--cuda`. Is this behaviour intended?

```
$ spk_run.py train schnet qm9 ./database.db ./model --split 5 5

INFO:root:Random state initialized with seed 1913397670
INFO:schnetpack.data.atoms:The dataset has already been downloaded and stored at ./database.db
INFO:root:create splits...
INFO:root:load data...
INFO:root:cached statistics was loaded...
INFO:root:building model...
INFO:root:The model you built has: 455809 parameters
INFO:root:training...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 123, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 62, in main
    trainer = get_trainer(args, model, train_loader, val_loader, metrics)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/utils/script_utils/training.py", line 50, in get_trainer
    trainer = spk.train.Trainer(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/train/trainer.py", line 60, in __init__
    self.restore_checkpoint()
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/train/trainer.py", line 143, in restore_checkpoint
    self.state_dict = torch.load(chkpt)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 607, in load
    return _load(opened_zipfile, map_location, pickle_module, **pickle_load_args)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 882, in _load
    result = unpickler.load()
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 857, in persistent_load
    load_tensor(data_type, size, key, _maybe_decode_ascii(location))
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 846, in load_tensor
    loaded_storages[key] = restore_location(storage, location)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 175, in default_restore_location
    result = fn(storage, location)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 157, in _cuda_deserialize
    return obj.cuda(device)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 79, in _cuda
    return new_type(self.size()).copy_(self, non_blocking)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 528, in _lazy_new
    return super(_CudaBase, cls).__new__(cls, *args, **kwargs)
RuntimeError: CUDA error: all CUDA-capable devices are busy or unavailable
CUDA kernel errors might be asynchronously reported at some other API call,so the stacktrace below might be incorrect.
For debugging consider passing CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING=1.
```

Since your modelpath does already exist, the script tries to continue the training session that has been stored in `./model`. Therefore it also uses the args that are stored in `args.json`. Could you try it again with a new modelpath? e.g. delete `./model` or use `./model2`

Deleted both the model and the database just to be sure:

```
$ spk_run.py train schnet qm9 ./database.db ./model --split 5 5

INFO:root:Random state initialized with seed 1424436646
INFO:schnetpack.data.atoms:The dataset has already been downloaded and stored at ./database.db
INFO:root:create splits...
INFO:root:load data...
INFO:schnetpack.data.loader:statistics will be calculated...
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCCachingHostAllocator.cpp line=278 error=46 : all CUDA-capable devices are busy or unavailable
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 123, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 48, in main
    mean, stddev = get_statistics(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/utils/script_utils/data.py", line 44, in get_statistics
    mean, stddev = train_loader.get_statistics(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/data/loader.py", line 197, in get_statistics
    for row in self:
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 521, in __next__
    data = self._next_data()
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 1203, in _next_data
    return self._process_data(data)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 1229, in _process_data
    data.reraise()
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 425, in reraise
    raise self.exc_type(msg)
RuntimeError: Caught RuntimeError in pin memory thread for device 0.
Original Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/pin_memory.py", line 34, in _pin_memory_loop
    data = pin_memory(data)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/pin_memory.py", line 54, in pin_memory
    return {k: pin_memory(sample) for k, sample in data.items()}
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/pin_memory.py", line 54, in <dictcomp>
    return {k: pin_memory(sample) for k, sample in data.items()}
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/pin_memory.py", line 50, in pin_memory
    return data.pin_memory()
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (46) : all CUDA-capable devices are busy or unavailable at /pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCCachingHostAllocator.cpp:278
```

By the way, I think the instructions for installing from source might be incomplete. In order to get the executables to run from any location, I had to include the `/src/scripts` directory in my `PATH`, and `chmod` all the files (only one of them had execute permissions).

Ok, this seems to be an issue with the dataloader. It seems like `pin_memory` was `True`, which caused the dataloader to copy some data to the GPUs which are blocked. I created a new branch "issue_324" where I removed `pin_memory`. Could you try, if this solves the issue?
For the installation: did you use `pip install .`?

Yes, training went fine, and evaluation has started successfully. Pretty slow on CPU, but I guess that's to be expected. I'll give it a try with `--cuda` when one of my GPUs is freed up. Thanks a lot for the quick fix.

Also, the installation worked properly now, guess I did something wrongly the first time.

PS: I edited the title to better reflect the actual error.
Nice to hear! Let me know, if it works well on your GPU, so we can update the master branch.

rename.from: Use GPU on a different device?
rename.to: GPU is being used, even with --cuda disabled

body:
One of my GPUs is free now, but I think torch might be trying to access the GPU that is still in use. Is it possible to specify the GPU I want to use? Or do I have to configure my GPU differently?

```
$ nvidia-smi 

Fri Sep  3 15:14:00 2021       
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 465.19.01    Driver Version: 465.19.01    CUDA Version: 11.3     |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                               |                      |               MIG M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  NVIDIA Quadro R...  On   | 00000000:3B:00.0  On |                  N/A |
| 67%   85C    P0   118W / 125W |   1145MiB /  7974MiB |     96%   E. Process |
|                               |                      |                  N/A |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
|   1  NVIDIA Quadro R...  On   | 00000000:5E:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 30%   40C    P8     6W / 125W |     13MiB /  7982MiB |      0%   E. Process |
|                               |                      |                  N/A |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
                                                                               
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                                  |
|  GPU   GI   CI        PID   Type   Process name                  GPU Memory |
|        ID   ID                                                   Usage      |
|=============================================================================|
|    0   N/A  N/A      1853      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                 41MiB |
|    0   N/A  N/A     36734      C   ...1-1/internal/bin/gdesmond      571MiB |
|    0   N/A  N/A     37603      G   gnome-control-center               38MiB |
|    0   N/A  N/A     39495      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                182MiB |
|    0   N/A  N/A    810034      G   /usr/lib/firefox/firefox           40MiB |
|    0   N/A  N/A   1059174      G   /usr/bin/gnome-shell              155MiB |
|    1   N/A  N/A      1853      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                  4MiB |
|    1   N/A  N/A     39495      G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                  4MiB |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

$ spk_run.py eval ./database.db ./model --split test --overwrite --cuda

INFO:schnetpack.data.atoms:The dataset has already been downloaded and stored at ./database.db
INFO:root:create splits...
INFO:root:load data...
INFO:root:loading trained model...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 123, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/home/user/.local/bin/spk_run.py", line 83, in main
    model = spk.utils.load_model(
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/schnetpack/utils/spk_utils.py", line 135, in load_model
    model = torch.load(model_path, map_location=map_location)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 607, in load
    return _load(opened_zipfile, map_location, pickle_module, **pickle_load_args)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 882, in _load
    result = unpickler.load()
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 857, in persistent_load
    load_tensor(data_type, size, key, _maybe_decode_ascii(location))
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 846, in load_tensor
    loaded_storages[key] = restore_location(storage, location)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 827, in restore_location
    return default_restore_location(storage, str(map_location))
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 175, in default_restore_location
    result = fn(storage, location)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 157, in _cuda_deserialize
    return obj.cuda(device)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 79, in _cuda
    return new_type(self.size()).copy_(self, non_blocking)
  File "/home/user/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 528, in _lazy_new
    return super(_CudaBase, cls).__new__(cls, *args, **kwargs)
RuntimeError: CUDA error: all CUDA-capable devices are busy or unavailable
CUDA kernel errors might be asynchronously reported at some other API call,so the stacktrace below might be incorrect.
For debugging consider passing CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING=1.
```

The good news, however, is that `spk_run.py` works perfectly when both of my GPUs are free. Though only the first GPU is being used, the performance is much better, as expected.

Any suggestions on how to configure GPU usage would be much appreciated.

You can specify the device by setting the environment variable CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES, e.g.
`CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0 python spk_run.yp ...`

issue.title: Issue 324

repository.name: schnetpack
repository.description: SchNetPack - Deep Neural Networks for Atomistic Systems

issue.body:
bug fix for issue #324:
pin_memory was also used for training on CPU

issue.title: Tutorial 2: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'cpu'

repository.name: schnetpack
repository.description: SchNetPack - Deep Neural Networks for Atomistic Systems

issue.body:
I'm trying out tutorial 2 (as of commit 422c6e649cf7a0d6c1489419e11d3f63dd9f84d2), but I'm encountering the following error in the second last cell:

```
Keys: ['_atomic_numbers', '_positions', '_neighbors', '_cell', '_cell_offset', '_atom_mask', '_neighbor_mask']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tutorial_02_qm9_nn.py", line 294, in <module>
    print("Truth:", props[QM9.U0].cpu().numpy()[0])
AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'cpu'
```

Does anyone know what might be wrong?
